title: Integrated Workflow for Particle Analysis in Nanoscale Materials: From Automatic Acquiring to Analysis Using (S)TEM/EDS
content: Particle analysis plays an important role in various scientific and engineering fields [1], including materials science, environmental science, energy, and food science and engineering. In materials science, for instance, understanding the characteristics of particle sizes, shapes, and crystal structures facilitates the design of new materials and enhances existing ones. In the case of catalysts, particle size changes due to poisoning can lead to a decrease in active surface area, resulting in lower catalytic activity and slower reaction rates.
